page.title: 01Headwaters The River Solva
page.content: The southern portion of this block forms the catchment area of the river Solva which flows into St Brides Bay 10 miles away.The northern part of the block slopes toward the north draining into the western arm of the river Cleddau. Most of the ground is around 400 feet a.s.l and due to its exposure to the prevailing south westerly winds from the Atlantic Ocean is largely treelss. The area is given over to agriculture being almost equally dairy farming and arable although a small area of horticulture exists in the east.The river Solva offers poor drainage which has caused a certain amount of bog land much of which has been reclaimed but is only suitable for grazing. Most of the farms are small family run enterprises.The first language of the natives is Welsh but few incomers bother to learn it.
